LanguageData.JRWDiplocaulus.label: Diplocaulus
LanguageData.JRWDiplocaulus.description:
-- > INGEN INTERNAL CASE FILE #03982-1877 [DIPLOCAULUS MAGNICORNUS] CODENAME: CAUL >332
A unique lepospondyl amphibian that lived during the late carboniferous period, related to modern day amphibians such as newts, frogs and caecilians. It has a bowed head that allow it to reduce water drag when striking prey from beneath the currents, a bizarre skeletal structure that is essentially exclusive to this species.
LanguageData.JRWDiplocaulus.tools.left_foot.label: left foot
LanguageData.JRWDiplocaulus.tools.right_foot.label: right foot
LanguageData.JRWDiplocaulus.tools.jaw.label: jaw
LanguageData.JRWDiplocaulus.tools.head.label: head
